attributes.action: to have the word ‘Honourable’ removed when addressing fellow MP’s.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I petition this government to have the word ‘Honourable’ removed when addressing fellow MP’s. The name “The Right Honourable” has long been cast into doubt, especially now the truth of how MP’s are blatantly abusing public funds and taxes in order to increase the wealth of themselves and their families. When considering what the word Honourable represents, “worthy of being honoured; entitled to honour and respect” and ”adhering to ethical and moral principles”, and then considering the number of MP’s who abuse public office in order to gain wealth and standing, it is not only a travesty, but is no longer moral to use this form of address.

rejection.details: This is a matter for Parliament, which has its own petitions system.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
